title: Week 3: January 12–18 - Genesis 1–2; Moses 2–3; Abraham 4–5
content:
**Lesson Overview**  
Jesus created a beautiful world for us because He loves us. (See "Jesus created the earth" in Come, Follow Me—For Home and Church: Old Testament 2026.)

**TEACHER LESSON**  
**Get Attention**  
Hold up a shiny apple or flower. "Look at this pretty thing Jesus made! Who made the world?" Let kids touch it and say "Jesus!"  

**Simple Story**  
Use pictures or act it out: "Day 1, Jesus made light! (Wave arms like light.) Day 2, sky! Day 3, land and plants! Up to Day 6, animals and people like you and me!" Kids copy your actions. (See Old Testament Stories, “The Creation of the Earth,” 8–12.)  

**Big Idea**  
Repeat together: "Jesus made a beautiful world for us!" Say it 3 times with claps.  

**We Can Do This**  
"Jesus made flowers—we can pick up toys to keep our world clean like He wants!" Show picking up a toy.  

**Wiggle Activity**  
Music & Movement: Sing "My Heavenly Father Loves Me" (Children’s Songbook, 228–29) while marching in a circle. Point to eyes, ears, flowers—wiggle fingers for "mountains so high." 2 minutes max!  

**Simple Scripture**  
Genesis 1:1: "In the beginning God created..."  
Say together 3 times. Hand motion: Arms wide like "beginning," then scoop hands for "created."  

**Fun Activities**  
**1. Creation Beanbag Toss (Game)**  
What to do: Toss beanbag to a child, say a creation day (light, animals), they name it or act it.  
Materials: Beanbag or soft ball.  
What to say: "Toss if Jesus made it! Light? Animals? Yay, Jesus did!" (3-4 turns each.)  

**2. Body Puzzle Craft (Hands-On Craft)**  
What to do: 1. Draw simple body outline. 2. Kids color and cut into 4 pieces. 3. Glue back as puzzle.  
Materials: Paper, crayons, scissors (help cut).  
What to say: "We look like Heavenly Father! Put your puzzle together—you are special like Him!" (See Genesis 1:26–27; Moses 2:26–27.)  

**3. Animal Freeze Dance (Music & Movement)**  
What to do: Play music, kids dance like animals Jesus made. Freeze when music stops, say "Jesus made me!"  
Materials: Phone for music (Primary songs).  
What to say: "Dance like fish or birds Jesus created! Freeze and thank Him!"  

**4. I Spy Creation Hunt (Physical Activity)**  
What to do: Hide 5 picture cards (sun, tree, animal). Kids search room, shout "Found it—Jesus made [it]!"  
Materials: Printed pics from Gospel Art Book.  
What to say: "I spy something Jesus made! Go find it and run back!" (See Genesis 1:1–25; Moses 2:1–25.)  

**Picture Time**  
Show "The Creation" by Annie Henrie Nader (Gospel Art Book). Ask: "What do you see Jesus making?" "How does it make you feel happy?" "Who made you special like this?"  

**Song**  
“My Heavenly Father Loves Me” (Children’s Songbook, 228–29). Actions: Hug self for "loves me," flap arms for birds, stomp for "so grand."  

**Snack Idea**  
Animal crackers! "Jesus made animals—yum, thank Him as we eat!" (Allergy-friendly.)  

**Testimony Moment**  
"I know Jesus created this beautiful world and loves each of you so much." Invite: "Say 'Jesus loves me!' Hug a friend."  

**Teacher Survival Tips**  
1. If kids get wiggly, start any activity with "Simon says: Stand up and wiggle!"  
2. Disruptions? Gently hug and whisper "Jesus made you special—let's play!" Redirect to nearest activity.  
3. Short on time? Skip one Fun Activity—do Picture Time twice with new questions.
